Articles.Content:
Release 2.1 is now available! Download here: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/tac-fuel-balancer-v1-0/

Changes:

  1. Hopefully, *cross fingers*, I fixed the Linux mouse bug. Please test it out and let me know. I rewrote the code handling it.
  2. The long overdue compatibility fix for StretchyTanks. Sorry for the delay .
  3. Added an x100 button for when you want to transfer a lot of fuel (or Kethane) quickly.

Note that I changed the directory structure. You will need to delete the old directory when upgrading.

{KSP}/ThunderAerospace/TacFuelBalancer

Edited November 19, 2013 by TaranisElsu

I've tested under Linux Mint 13 for an hour. Works Perfectly!

Great Thanx!
This mod, along with KW, B9, and FAR is one of those that I can't live without. Thanks.
@TaranisElsu: Any plans to upodate FB due to Toolbar Plugin 1.1.0 - Common API for draggable/resizable buttons toolbar?

@TaranisElsu: Any plans to upodate FB due to Toolbar Plugin 1.1.0 - Common API for draggable/resizable buttons toolbar?

I might get around to it eventually. I would prefer to allow users the option to use it or not, rather than make it a hard dependency on it.
@TaranisElsu: That would be perfecto!

I might get around to it eventually. I would prefer to allow users the option to use it or not, rather than make it a hard dependency on it.

There's a class for that. Feel free to use it if it's helpful to you.
Random user here. I would love to have more things in that little toolbar.
Is this mod .23 compatible?
It was working for me last night. Didn't notice any problems.

Random user here. I would love to have more things in that little toolbar.

I'll second that, it's a handy toolbar
Toolbar +1
Toolbar +1
While I don't like polluting threads with statements like that, the need is great -- amen to the toolbar +1.
Toolbar +1

Is this mod .23 compatible?

The 0.22 version has been working fine for me in 0.23

Release v2.2 is now up.

Changes

  • Updated for 0.23.

Download from http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/tac-fuel-balancer-v1-0/
Many thanks for the update.

Love the plugin! Any chance we can get integration with Blizzy's toolbar API?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/60863

Oh yes, that would be nice. Almost all of the mods I am using are in the toolbar now. so much more screen is usable and I dont 'lose' them any more.... Yes, if at all possible, the ability to put into toolbar would be great...

Thanks for great mod...
Love the mod. It's a perfect candidate for the toolbar though! It'd be awesome if some of these great utility mods agreed on this standard.

Changes

* Now works with the Toolbar mod from blizzy78. Not required, but if you have it, the icon will be added to the toolbar instead of being by itself.

Download from http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/tac-fuel-balancer-v1-0/

I need to make another button texture. For now, I just resized the old one to 24x24. Any volunteers?

Edited December 23, 2013 by TaranisElsu
Can you add an option to balance all stages at once (next to the "balance all" button), so it get's easier to balance large multi-tank rockets.

I need to make another button texture. For now, I just resized the old one to 24x24. Any volunteers?

How about this ?

I use this a lot, and I second the 'stage balance' option, though perhaps just select options for all tanks on that radial symmetry would help? IE able to change the options for all tanks radially symmetric at once.

Also, some ships need multiple fuel balances if things get complex. Would it be possible to save a configuration, then half way through a launch load the next config to change the fuel load? Sometimes you need to hold all the fuel in the final stage, but if you put that all in 'transfer in' when you get down to that stage only it can shift things around based on mounts of engines. I had a core tank, and six radial tanks, all in the final stage. I put them all on 'transfer in' and it helped keep the previous stage running right. Unfortunately the main engines for that final stage were on the radial tanks, so drew from the center tank (based on the normal fuel lines) and I had secondary nuke engines on the center. Once in orbit I wondered why the nukes said 'fuel deprived'. Doh! Still, that wasn't a problem to fix given I was already in orbit. Sometimes it could get tricky during an ascent!

This mod has improved things so much I'm almost tempted to just do away with fuel lines on some ships and just use this! *lol* Might solve some of the problems.
